title: Gábor Esterházy (1673–1704)
text:
Count Gábor (Gabriel) Esterházy de Galántha (15 April 1673 – 13 December 1704) was a Hungarian imperial general and noble, son of <a href="Paul%20I%2C%20Prince%20Esterh%C3%A1zy">Paul I, Prince Esterházy</a> and <a href="Orsolya%20Esterh%C3%A1zy">Orsolya Esterházy</a>.
Career.
He studied in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a> and became imperial knight in 1690. He also functioned as a royal chamberlain and councillor. Count Esterházy served as "<a href="isp%C3%A1n">ispán</a>" of <a href="Fej%C3%A9r%20County%20%28former%29">Fejér County</a> between 1688 and 16 September 1691. After that he was appointed "ispán" of <a href="Somogy%20County%20%28former%29">Somogy</a> and <a href="Zala%20County%20%28former%29">Zala Counties</a>. He resigned from his preceding position on 29 March 1713. He became imperial general in 1701 and functioned as the commander of the Hungarian cavalry regiment. He died of <a href="smallpox">smallpox</a> in 1704.
Family.
Count Gábor Esterházy married Countess Margaretha Christina von Abensberg und Traun (1677–1725) on 24 May 1694 in Vienna. They had six children:
